bug.short_desc: Warning to avoid accidental placement of large address books in the To: and Cc: fields

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Eudora OSE 1.0
System enhancement, not a bug per se: It is easy to accidentally place large address books intended for the Bcc: field into the To: or Cc: field. When sent out as such many private addresses are revealed and also many messages are rejected by email servers as possible spam. This human error can be avoided by adding a warning to any message being sent out with more than "X" number of addresses in the To: or Cc: fields. The system could allow for the user to enter the number of addresses to allow in preferences. The warning would provide an OK or cancel send option.
Reproducible: Always
